page.title: 12PLANT FARM
page.content: Records show that the farm has been there since 1200AD and is situated near the old Roman road from Fishbourne to Portchester on the southern edge of the Forest Of Bere. The local name for the area is Forest End. The farm covers 260 acres and is used mainly for crops which are sown in winter or spring and reaped the following year. 115 acres of wheat,60 acres of barley, 30 acres of oats and 20 acres of potatoes comprise the crops shown. The remaining 35 acres are too wet to plough for crops so they are used for grassland to feed 30 Friesan beef cattle in summer and to provide hay for feeding them in winter. The cattle are bought when they are 10 weeks old and are sold when they are 2 years old. Plant Farm is 1 of 20 farms on the Southwick Estate which covers 5000 acres in all.
